org.gm4java.engine.support

Class PooledGMService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gm4java.engine.support.PooledGMService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GMExecutor, GMService

    public class PooledGMService
extends Object
implements GMService
    A GMService that manages and uses a pool of GraphicsMagick instances. This implementation uses GenericObjectPool from Apache Commons Pool project.
    Author:
    Kenneth Xu

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public String execute(@Nonnull
             String command,
             String... arguments)
               throws GMException,
                      GMServiceException
        Executes the GraphisMagick command and return the result.

        This is a convenient method to get the connection, execute the command once and close it. It is functionally equivalent to code below, but actual implementation may optimize this for better efficiency. 

         final GMConnection connection = gmService.getConnection();
 try {
     return connection.execute(command, argument1, argument2, ...);
 } finally {
     connection.close();
 }

        This method is thread safe.

        Specified by:
        execute in interface GMExecutor
        Specified by:
        execute in interface GMService
        Parameters:
        command - the command to be executed
        arguments - arguments of the command.
        Returns:
        the output from GraphicsMagick as the result of executing the command
        Throws:
        GMException - when GraphicsMagick returns error executing the command
        GMServiceException - when there is error communicating with the underlying GraphicsMagick process
        See Also:
        GMExecutor.execute(List)

      • execute

        public String execute(List<String> command)
               throws GMException,
                      GMServiceException
        Description copied from interface: GMService
        Executes the command using the underlying GraphicsMagick process. GraphicsMagick command and its arguments are passed in as a list of strings.

        This is a convenient method to get the connection, execute the command once and close it. It is functionally equivalent to code below, but actual implementation may optimize this for better efficiency. 

         final GMConnection connection = gmService.getConnection();
 try {
     return connection.execute(command);
 } finally {
     connection.close();
 }

        This method is thread safe.

        Specified by:
        execute in interface GMExecutor
        Specified by:
        execute in interface GMService
        Parameters:
        command - the command and arguments to be executed
        Returns:
        the output from GraphicsMagick as the result of executing the command
        Throws:
        GMException - when GraphicsMagick returns error executing the command
        GMServiceException - when there is error communicating with the underlying GraphicsMagick process
        See Also:
        GMService.execute(String, String...)

      • getConnection

        @Nonnull
public GMConnection getConnection()
                           throws GMServiceException
        Gets an instance of GMConnection. Depends on the implementation, the instance can be newly created or from a pool.

        This method is thread safe.

        This implementation returns an instance from pool.

        Specified by:
        getConnection in interface GMService
        Returns:
        an instance of GMConnection
        Throws:
        GMServiceException - when communicate error occurs between the physical GraphicsMagick process.
